Label: Household Size
Notes: Count of Person records in household

Label: Purchase and Prepare Food Together
Notes: Defines SNAP household unit

Label: Living Arrangement
Notes: SSI benefits reduced for certain living arrangements; Medicaid non-MAGI: institutional vs community determines pathway

Label: Homeless Status
Notes: Homeless youth categorically eligible for Summer EBT

Label: Physical Address State
Notes: Determines state of residence for eligibility

Label: Physical Address County
Notes: County may determine local benefit office and benefit levels

Label: State Residency Since
Notes: 42 CFR 435.403 (no durational requirement, but intent to reside required)

Label: Family Type
Notes: Section 8 family classification

Label: Monthly Rent Amount
Policy/Statute: 7 CFR 273.9(d)(6) (SNAP shelter deduction); 24 CFR 982.503 (Section 8 payment standard)

Label: Monthly Property Tax
Notes: Included in SNAP shelter cost calculation

Label: Telephone Cost
Notes: SNAP standard telephone allowance

Label: Primary Contact Email
Notes: Optional but increasingly used for notices and correspondence

Label: Preferred Language
Notes: Required for language access compliance under Title VI of the Civil Rights Act

Label: Household ID
Notes: FK to Household

Label: Social Security Number
Notes: Summer EBT follows NSLP rules: one household member SSN or declaration of none

Label: Race
Notes: Not used for eligibility; collected for civil rights reporting

Label: Ethnicity
Notes: Not used for eligibility; collected for civil rights reporting

Label: Citizenship Status
Notes: OBBBA narrowed SNAP non-citizen eligibility to: US citizens, US nationals, LPRs (with 5-year bar), Cuban/Haitian entrants, and COFA citizens only. Refugees, asylees, trafficking victims, parolees, and other qualified aliens no longer SNAP-eligible. Other programs' citizenship rules unchanged. Summer EBT follows NSLP rules.Modified

Label: Qualified Alien Status Category
Notes: Required when non-citizen

Label: Expected Due Date
Summer EBT: Medicaid counts unborn in household size (MAGI); WIC eligibility

Label: Number of Expected Children
Notes: Medicaid MAGI counts each expected child for household size

Label: Delivery Date
Summer EBT: Used to determine postpartum status for WIC (up to 6 months post-delivery)

Label: Nutritional Risk Conditions
Policy/Statute: Array in implementation â€” a person may have multiple risk conditions simultaneously

Label: Foster Care Status
Notes: Foster children categorically eligible for Summer EBT; Medicaid mandatory for foster youth

Label: Former Foster Youth (age 18-26)
OBBBA (H.R.1): Medicaid to age 26 for former foster youth

Label: Enrolled in School
Policy/Statute: Must be enrolled in NSLP/SBP-participating school

Label: School Name
Policy/Statute: Identifies the school for Summer EBT verification

Label: School District
Policy/Statute: Used to verify school participates in NSLP/SBP

Label: Migrant Youth Status
Policy/Statute: Migrant youth categorically eligible for Summer EBT

Label: Runaway Youth Status
Policy/Statute: Runaway youth categorically eligible for Summer EBT

Label: Head Start Participant
Policy/Statute: Head Start participants categorically eligible for Summer EBT

Label: Age
Notes: Derived from dateOfBirth; used in many eligibility rules

Label: School Age (approx 5-18)
Policy/Statute: Derived from dateOfBirth; must be school-age for Summer EBT

Label: Elderly or Disabled (SNAP)
Notes: Derived: age >= 65 or meets SSA disability definition; determines SNAP deductions/resource limits. OBBBA: only elderly/disabled households qualify for automatic HCSUA from LIHEAP payments for SNAP shelter deduction (Section 10103).Modified

Label: ABAWD Status
Notes: Derived: age 18-64 (OBBBA raised from 54), not disabled, no dependentsModified

Label: Disability Status (meets SSA definition)
Notes: Required for SNAP elderly/disabled provisions, SSI eligibility, and Medicaid non-MAGI disabled pathway

Label: Type of Disability/Impairment
Notes: Simplified for application purposes; SSA uses a complex five-step sequential evaluation with detailed medical evidence

Label: Unable to Engage in Substantial Gainful Activity
Notes: SSI SGA determination; also used for Medicaid non-MAGI disabled pathway

Label: Disability Duration (12+ months or terminal)
Notes: SSI duration requirement; also applies to Medicaid non-MAGI disabled pathway

Label: Blind (meets SSA definition)
Notes: SSI blindness; also qualifies for Medicaid non-MAGI blind pathway

Label: Employer-Sponsored Insurance Available
Policy/Statute: CHIP waiting period for employer coverage

Label: Employer Insurance Affordable
Notes: Relevant for Medicaid MAGI/marketplace eligibility

Label: Veteran Status
Notes: Section 8 PHAs commonly grant veteran preference; 24 CFR 982.207

Label: Indian/Tribal Member Status
Policy/Statute: Indian Health Care Improvement Act; OBBBA Sections 10107 and 2501
Notes: As defined in IHCIA: Indian, Urban Indian, or California Indian. OBBBA added as SNAP ABAWD exemption and Medicaid community engagement exemption category.New field

Label: Student Status (higher education)
Notes: 7 CFR 273.5 (SNAP); 24 CFR 5.612 (Section 8)
OBBBA (H.R.1): Students in higher education generally ineligible for SNAP; Section 8 restricts full-time student heads of household

Label: SNAP Work Registration
Policy/Statute: Most SNAP applicants 16-59 must register for work; separate from ABAWD requirement

Label: SNAP Work Registration Exempt
Policy/Statute: Exempt: disabled, caretaker of child under 6, student, already working 30+ hrs, etc.

Label: ABAWD Exemption Reason
Notes: OBBBA: dependent child age changed from under 18 to under 14; added Indian/tribal member exemption; removed homeless, veteran, and former foster youth exemptions (added by 2023 FRA, struck by OBBBA)Modified

Label: Medicaid Community Engagement Exemption Reason
Notes: Applies to Medicaid expansion population ages 19-64. States must implement these exemption categories. Hardship exemptions available for hospitalization, disaster, high unemployment areas.New field

Label: Medicaid Community Engagement Hours Per Month
Notes: 80 hours/month of qualifying activities: employment, work program/job training, education (half-time), community service, or combination. Effective Jan 2027.New field

Label: TANF Time Limit Months Used
Notes: 60-month federal lifetime limit

Label: TANF Total Work Hours Per Week
Notes: Derived: sum of WorkActivity.hoursPerWeek; 30 hrs/week (single parent) or 35 hrs/week (two-parent)

Label: Cooperates with Child Support Enforcement
Notes: TANF recipients must cooperate unless good cause

Label: Child Support Cooperation Good Cause Exemption
Notes: Good cause: domestic violence, danger to child, etc.

Label: Minor Parent Living Arrangement
Notes: TANF requires minor parents to live with parent/guardian or in supervised setting

Label: Good Cause Exemption from Work Requirements
Striker Status
Notes: Strikers generally ineligible for SNAP

Label: Institutional Status
Policy/Statute: Inmates ineligible for most programs; nursing_facility triggers Medicaid LTC pathway

Label: Expected Release Date
Notes: Medicaid suspension/reinstatement for incarcerated individuals

Label: Needs Long-Term Care
Notes: Whether applying for nursing facility or HCBS waiver Medicaid

Label: Level of Care Assessment
Notes: Functional assessment determining required care level; required for institutional and waiver Medicaid

Label: Spouse Is Institutionalized
Notes: Triggers spousal impoverishment protections under MCCA; determines Community Spouse Resource Allowance

Label: Date of Institutionalization
Notes: Required when spouseIsInstitutionalized is true. Snapshot date for assessing countable resources under spousal impoverishment rules.

Label: Sex Offender Registry Status
Notes: Section 8 lifetime ban

Label: Substantial Lottery/Gambling Winnings
Notes: Categorical ineligibility for substantial lottery winnings (SNAP)

Label: Lottery/Gambling Winnings Amount
Notes: Required if substantialLotteryWinnings is true

Label: Receives Other Public Benefits
Notes: Derived from BenefitParticipation records; used for categorical/adjunctive eligibility. Non-MAGI: SSI receipt often confers automatic Medicaid. WIC: adjunctive eligibility via SNAP/Medicaid/TANF (7 CFR 246.7(d))

Label: Deemed Income from Spouse
Notes: SSI spousal deeming calculation

Label: Deemed Income from Parent
Notes: SSI parental deeming calculation (if child)

Label: Tax Filing Status
Policy/Statute: Medicaid MAGI household determination; not used for non-MAGI

Label: Claimed as Tax Dependent by Another
Claimed as Dependent By (Person ID)
Policy/Statute: FK to Person who claims this person as dependent

Label: Person ID
Notes: FK to Person

Label: Net Amount
Summer EBT: Derived: grossAmount minus applicable deductions; 7 CFR 273.9(d) for SNAP 20% earned income deduction; non-MAGI uses SSI-methodology deductions in most states

Label: Seasonal or Irregular Income
Policy/Statute: Affects how income is annualized for eligibility determination

Label: Hours Worked Per Week
Summer EBT: For employment/self-employment; ABAWD and TANF work requirements

Label: Employer Name
Notes: For employment type

Label: Employer Address Street
Notes: For employment type

Label: Tips and Commissions
Policy/Statute: For employment type; included in gross income

Label: Self-Employment Business Expenses
Policy/Statute: For self_employment type; deducted from gross

Label: Verification Source
Notes: All programs require income verification

Label: Employment Income
Notes: Which programs require disclosure of this income type

Label: In-Kind Support and Maintenance
Notes: SSI-specific; contributions from others

Label: Person ID
Notes: FK to Person

Label: Asset Type
Notes: Non-MAGI Medicaid: $2,000 individual / $3,000 couple resource limit (most states follow SSI methodology); Section 8: imputed income from net family assets > $5,000; $50,000 hard asset cap

Label: Account Number
Notes: For financial accounts

Label: Vehicle Make
Notes: For vehicle type

Label: Vehicle Fair Market Value
Policy/Statute: 7 CFR 273.8(f) (SNAP vehicle exclusion); 20 CFR 416.1218 (SSI auto exclusion)

Label: Vehicle Use
Notes: Determines exclusions

Label: Property Description
Notes: For real_property type; Section 8 counts real property equity

Label: Is Primary Residence
Policy/Statute: 7 CFR 273.8(e)(3) (SNAP home exclusion); 20 CFR 416.1212 (SSI home exclusion)
Notes: Homestead generally excluded

Label: Life Insurance Face Value
Notes: SSI: excluded if face value under $1,500; same rule used in most states for non-MAGI Medicaid

Label: Life Insurance Cash Surrender Value
Notes: Countable resource if face value over limit; Section 8 counts cash value

Label: Burial Fund Amount
Notes: SSI: $1,500 burial fund exclusion; non-MAGI Medicaid follows same rule in most states

Label: Trust Type
Notes: Special needs trusts may be excluded (SSI and Medicaid)

Label: Assets Transferred or Sold Recently
Notes: 20 CFR 416.1246 (SSI: 36-month look-back); 42 USC 1396p(c) (Medicaid LTC: 60-month look-back per DRA 2005)
OBBBA (H.R.1): SSI uses 36-month look-back; Medicaid non-MAGI LTC uses 60-month look-back. Application should collect all transfers within 60 months to cover both.

Label: Transfer Date
Notes: Required if asset was recently transferred

Label: Verification Source
Policy/Statute: All programs with asset tests require verification

Label: Cash on Hand
Policy/Statute: Which programs require disclosure of this asset type

Label: IRA
Notes: Some retirement accounts excluded (SNAP); varies by state (TANF); Section 8 counts retirement accounts; non-MAGI Medicaid follows SSI rules in most states

Label: Vehicles
Notes: Section 8 does not count vehicles as assets

OBBBA (H.R.1): Replaces single-value expense fields on Person; each record is one expense obligation

Label: Person ID
Notes: FK to Person

Label: Expense Type
Notes: SNAP deductions: 7 CFR 273.9(d); Medicaid non-MAGI spend-down: 42 CFR 435.831; Section 8 deductions: 24 CFR 5.611

Label: Recipient or Provider
Policy/Statute: E.g., daycare name for dependent_care; child name for child_support_paid

Label: Description
Notes: Additional detail if needed

Label: For Person ID (if dependent care)
Summer EBT: FK to Person; identifies which dependent the care expense is for

Label: Dependent Care
OBBBA (H.R.1): Which programs use this expense type

Label: Medical Insurance Premium
Notes: 7 CFR 273.9(d)(3) (SNAP elderly/disabled); 42 CFR 435.831 (Medicaid spend-down); 24 CFR 5.611(a)(5) (Section 8 elderly/disabled)
OBBBA (H.R.1): SNAP: only for elderly/disabled household members; Medicaid non-MAGI: deducted in spend-down calculation

Label: Medical Recurring Expense
OBBBA (H.R.1): SNAP: only elderly/disabled; amounts over $35/month. Section 8: elderly/disabled; amounts over 3% annual income. Medicaid non-MAGI: all medical expenses count toward spend-down

Label: Medical One-Time Expense
OBBBA (H.R.1): SNAP: only elderly/disabled. Medicaid non-MAGI: counts toward spend-down

Label: Disability Assistance Expense
column21: Section 8: attendant care or auxiliary apparatus for disabled family member enabling work

OBBBA (H.R.1): Replaces otherBenefitsReceived text field; tracks current and past benefit receipt for categorical/adjunctive eligibility

Label: Person ID
Notes: FK to Person

Label: Benefit Type
OBBBA (H.R.1): Programs that use categorical/adjunctive eligibility

Label: Start Date
Notes: When benefit receipt began

Label: End Date
Notes: Null if currently receiving

Label: Case/Benefit Number
Notes: For verification of benefit receipt

Label: SNAP
Notes: Which benefit types trigger categorical/adjunctive eligibility for which programs

Label: Medicaid
Notes: WIC adjunctive eligibility; Summer EBT categorical eligibility

Label: TANF
Notes: SNAP categorical; WIC adjunctive; Summer EBT categorical

Label: SSI
Notes: SNAP categorical eligibility; SSI recipients receive automatic Medicaid in most (1634) states

Label: FDPIR
Notes: Summer EBT categorical eligibility

Label: Head Start
Notes: Summer EBT categorical eligibility

Label: Free School Meals
Notes: Summer EBT categorical eligibility

Label: Reduced-Price School Meals
Notes: Summer EBT categorical eligibility

OBBBA (H.R.1): Replaces single-value health insurance fields; a person may have multiple coverages simultaneously

Label: Person ID
Notes: FK to Person

Label: Medicare Part
Notes: For medicare coverageType only. Determines eligibility for Medicaid Savings Programs: QMB (Part A required), SLMB, QI.

Label: Policy Number
Notes: For verification

Label: Coverage End Date
Notes: Used to determine CHIP waiting period after employer coverage loss; Medicaid is payer of last resort (42 CFR 433.138)

Label: Monthly Premium
Policy/Statute: SNAP: medical deduction for elderly/disabled includes insurance premiums; Medicaid non-MAGI: counts toward spend-down

OBBBA (H.R.1): Replaces flat sponsor fields; captures full sponsor data needed for deeming calculations under PRWORA

Label: Person ID
Notes: FK to Person (the sponsored immigrant)

Label: Sponsor Name
Notes: 7 CFR 273.4(c)(2) (SNAP); 42 CFR 435.145 (Medicaid)

Label: Sponsor Household Size
Notes: Needed for sponsor deeming calculation

Label: Sponsor Countable Resources
Notes: SNAP and Medicaid non-MAGI sponsor deeming includes resources

Label: Number of Persons Sponsored
Notes: Sponsor income/resources divided among all sponsored persons

Label: Affidavit of Support (I-864) Date
Notes: 8 USC 1183a
OBBBA (H.R.1): Date of legally binding affidavit
A person may have different authorized representatives for different scopes (e.g., one for application, another for benefit receipt per 7 CFR 273.2(n)(3))

Label: Person ID
Notes: FK to Person

Label: Address Line 1
Notes: For correspondence

OBBBA (H.R.1): Replaces single tanfWorkActivityType; TANF participants may combine multiple activities to meet hour requirements

Label: Person ID
Notes: FK to Person

Label: Activity Type
OBBBA (H.R.1): Countable TANF work activities

Label: End Date
Notes: Null if ongoing

OBBBA (H.R.1): Derived/calculated results; not applicant-provided

Label: Person ID
Notes: FK to Person

Label: Household ID
Notes: FK to Household

Label: Gross Monthly Income (household)
Notes: Annualized from all Income records, converted to monthly

Label: Net Monthly Income (household)
Policy/Statute: Gross minus applicable deductions (earned income, shelter, dependent care, etc.); non-MAGI uses SSI-methodology deductions

Label: Countable Resources
Notes: Total assets minus exclusions

Label: Income as % of Federal Poverty Level
Notes: Based on household size and gross income

Label: Spend-Down Amount
OBBBA (H.R.1): Medically needy spend-down: amount of medical expenses person must incur to reduce countable income to medically needy income level. Only applies to non-MAGI Medicaid.

Label: Categorically Eligible
OBBBA (H.R.1): SNAP: receiving TANF/SSI; WIC: adjunctive via SNAP/Medicaid/TANF; Summer EBT: SNAP/Medicaid/TANF/foster/homeless/migrant/runaway/Head Start; Medicaid non-MAGI: SSI recipients in 1634 states

Label: Income Eligible
Notes: Gross and/or net income within program limits

Label: Resource Eligible
Policy/Statute: Programs with asset tests; non-MAGI Medicaid: $2,000/$3,000 (most states); Section 8: $50,000 cap

Label: Citizenship Eligible
Notes: Section 8 requires eligible citizenship/immigration status

Label: Work Requirement Met
Notes: OBBBA Section 2501 (Medicaid); 45 CFR 261.31 (TANF)
OBBBA (H.R.1): OBBBA adds Medicaid community engagement requirement for expansion population ages 19-64, effective Jan 2027. TANF work participation was already federally required.Modified

Label: School Enrollment Verified
Notes: Summer EBT: child enrolled in NSLP/SBP-participating school

Label: Overall Eligible
Notes: All eligibility factors satisfied

Label: Determination Reason
Notes: Explanation of eligibility/ineligibility; free text appropriate here as reasons are highly variable
